episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features discussions on unique uses of soap, the peculiar funeral arrangements of Thomas Hardy, the role of fashion historians in forensic investigations, and the sleep patterns of penguins. The hosts explore these topics with humor and interesting anecdotes, including guest presenter Rhys James sharing his insights.

facts.fact: Soap is the best way to move a building.
The 19th century author, Thomas Hardy, had two funerals at the same time.
The UK literally have fashion police.
Parents of newborn penguins take thousands of naps per day.
